intro: Crataegus saeva, commonly known as the blackthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in hedgerows, woodlands, and rocky soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its flowers are white or pale pink, appearing in early spring before the leaves, and its fruits ripen in late summer. The bark and berries have been used in traditional medicine for their astringent and medicinal properties.
